alert.note: Alert for Creek; Delaware; Mayes; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 06 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Craig, Creek, Delaware, Mayes, Nowata, Osage, Ottawa, Pawnee, Rogers, Tulsa and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread showers and thunderstorms are ongoing early this morning across northeast Oklahoma. Heavy rainfall continues with the stronger storms and rainfall totals of 1 to 2 inches will be common through sunrise across northeast Oklahoma. Locally heavy amounts near 3 inches are possible and these amounts could lead to isolated flooding concerns. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
